intro: Lindsayopsis divaricata, commonly known as the variable lindsayopsis, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
